TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
[quote name='minepagan']Looks nice!
Any chance of a version with the hatch on the side, so you could mount it inline?[/QUOTE]

Thanks!

Sadly there is just not the texture space for an inline hatch.

Aww.....

On another note, for all current and future IVAs, could you make the EVA & Crew transfer hatches separate props?
Quick question... The huge round solar panels in the Glushkos Dream vid, what are they from?

[quote name='CatastrophicFailure']Quick question... The huge round solar panels in the Glushkos Dream vid, what are they from?[/QUOTE]

NF Solar + Tweakscale. :)

Some bugs:

old Fuji parts still in catalogue (aside from new capsule/heatshield) are referring to a missing texture from folder of the old pod. (no texture on engine, solar, orbital pod, etc etc etc)
Adding it back (just the folder and the texture, not the model/cfg) fixed the issue.

[quote name='minepagan']Aww.....

On another note, for all current and future IVAs, could you make the EVA & Crew transfer hatches separate props?[/QUOTE]

Possibly, I'm still waiting for the new shaders before starting any IVA work :)

[quote name='Araym']Some bugs:

old Fuji parts still in catalogue (aside from new capsule/heatshield) are referring to a missing texture from folder of the old pod. (no texture on engine, solar, orbital pod, etc etc etc)
Adding it back (just the folder and the texture, not the model/cfg) fixed the issue.[/QUOTE]

Thanks!

Hopefully the next release will see the full release of re-vamped Fuji parts :)

In-Game.

Very useful parts, at the very least fun ready-made orbital tug.

Oh, God, almost page 1,000. Good job, Beale!

Anyway, please, please, please, make the ATV's second stage for the Ariane 5... That would be sick. Also some ATV panels? I know you overhauled it recently but you missed a few things. :P

Plus Ariane is long overdue for an actual second stage!
I thought Queso was working on the ATV panels.

[quote name='CobaltWolf']I thought Queso was working on the ATV panels.[/QUOTE]

I did a decent first pass at them, but I ended up figuring out that I made them too small, and my texturing skills are nearly nonexistent, so I think it'd be best if Beale tackled them. I don't know why, but they just didn't look quite right. I gave him my setup in wings with an orthographic sketch in it, so it should be really easy for him to do if he puts a little time into it. He can do in hours what takes me days. Plus, I just don't have the time right now. I've had to take a step back from part creation and KSP in general. Still following what you all are doing though. :)

Ariane on the whole needs a little work, as well as a second stage. The textures are absolutely perfect, but the scaling is way off. 3.0m or 3.125m would work, but it brings us back to the off-sizes debate. Yikes. :P

[quote name='VenomousRequiem']Oh, God, almost page 1,000. Good job, Beale!

Anyway, please, please, please, make the ATV's second stage for the Ariane 5... That would be sick. Also some ATV panels? I know you overhauled it recently but you missed a few things. :P

Plus Ariane is long overdue for an actual second stage![/QUOTE]

I think you mean [B]10,000[/B] comments... :D

Out of curiosity, did the weight of the soyuz parts (CM/SM/OM) change on the most recent update? I'm having [U]severe[/U] R7+Soyuz tipping-over problems again. Same problem as 2 months ago, if the attitude dot gets even one pixel outside of the little green direction-of-travel circle, then the rocket instantly tips. Tried dozens of combinations of altitude, speed, etc.

Pic with COM indicated:
[URL]http://oi68.tinypic.com/33agfns.jpg[/URL] Edited November 21, 2015 by tjsnh

[quote name='tjsnh']Out of curiosity, did the weight of the soyuz parts (CM/SM/OM) change on the most recent update? I'm having [U]severe[/U] R7+Soyuz tipping-over problems again. Same problem as 2 months ago, if the attitude dot gets even one pixel outside of the little green direction-of-travel circle, then the rocket instantly tips. Tried dozens of combinations of altitude, speed, etc.

Pic with COM indicated:
[URL]http://oi68.tinypic.com/33agfns.jpg[/URL][/QUOTE] same problem here, Soyuz seems to be top-heavy

[quote name='trooperMNG']same problem here, Soyuz seems to be top-heavy[/QUOTE]

I've added some fins clipped into the tank of the "core" stage near the bottom, seems to have addressed the issue for the time being, but the COG issues remain - I'll do more experimenting with changing weights around, it shouldn't require extra fins to launch the showcase rocket of the pack. I'll report back if I get anything working without extra parts attached.

I'll report back if I get anything working without extra parts attached.[/QUOTE]

Nothing I can do about it really.

Hello Beale,

since the release of version 14 the "Tavio RD-01" decoupler lost.
It is troublesome to restore the old files with every update.
Please try to complete your update starting from the version 13.x.

Thank you and have a nice weekend
